TextEquiv.Unicode: -1731. A piece of pewter with stranger flashes left upon it, half
melted
by lightening & a piece of the shelfe it stood on shalterd but
not burnt, wt. a belemnites found two feet deep in the
ground underneath; The earth was black round the hole
& had a strong sulphureous smell, & the smoak continued
1/2 an hour after in the room tho a nothing was sett on fire
From Mr. Winthorp from New England.
-1732. A bundle of Indian candles or splinters of pitch tree. Id.
-1733. An Indian box made of the bark of the birch tree by the Indians
& dyed by the spaw water springs. Id.
300. -1734. A fountain wt. rocks made of China earth &c. given me by Mr. Roberts.
-1735. A fine large Indian basket made by an Indian Queen by
Mr. Winthorpe from N. England.
-1736. A fishing line made of the wild Indian hemp , wt.
shank bone of a fawn which serves both as hook &
bait, the fish biting at it & swallowing it down.
S B
Id.

-1731. A piece of pewter with stranger flashes left upon it, half melted by lightening & a piece of the shelfe it stood on shalterd but not burnt, wt. a belemnites found two feet deep in the ground underneath; The earth was black round the hole & had a strong sulphureous smell, & the smoak continued 1/2 an hour after in the room tho a nothing was sett on fire From Mr. Winthorp from New England. 149 -1732. A bundle of Indian candles or splinters of pitch tree. Id. -1733. An Indian box made of the bark of the birch tree by the Indians ✓ 20 H & dyed by the spaw water springs. Id. 300. -1734. A fountain wt. rocks made of China earth &c. given me by Mr. Roberts. -1735. A fine large Indian basket made by an Indian Queen by Mr. Winthorpe from N. England. -1736. A fishing line made of the wild Indian hemp , wt. ✓ shank bone of a fawn which serves both as hook & 19 P. bait, the fish biting at it & swallowing it down. S B Id.
--- made of gold beaters skin? from
( Purse ? )
Holland.
-1738. An Indian mattump or braided stray wt. wch. they tye their
children to the bark of a tree as soon as born from
Mr. Winthorp from New England.
O. 245. -1739. An Indian Calumet or stone pipe of peace. Id. (red?)
-1740. Glue made of dears horns & fishes sounds by the Indians
< 19 m in America to glue the feathers into their arrows. Id.
-1741. A square piece of shell worn as an ornament by the
Indians & formerly current as 3 shillings in money
among the Indians. Id.

25 -1737. A --- made of gold beaters skin? from ( Purse ? ) Holland. 216 n -1738. An Indian Calumet or stone pipe of peace. Id. (red?) -1740. Glue made of dears horns & fishes sounds by the Indians < 19 m in America to glue the feathers into their arrows. Id. -1741. A square piece of shell worn as an ornament by the 28 b. Indians & formerly current as 3 shillings in money among the Indians. Id.
-1742. Money worth 2d. a piece made of the paquahaguer shell Id.
6d. a piece. Id.
1sh. a piece. Id.
purple. Id.
called
-1746. Six worth one penny white Wampampeage. Id.
-1747. Four worth one penny blue called Wampampeage. Id.
C 245. -1748. A Turkish tobacco pipe made of a cane & earthen bole sold for
lesse then a penny in Turky.
